result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) and Operating w/ PAC (3rd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (3rd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Jason M Resop was found guilty of OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
11:58 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Michael Sias.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  DA recites agreement - defendant will plea to count 1 and the balance of the counts will be dismissed and read-in, and the refusal 2016TR402 will be re-opened and dismissed.  Atty Sias concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 as charged.  Court orders count 2 & 5 be dismissed outright and the balance of the counts be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Sias.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

-75 days county jail, with huber.  Court grants out of county service and out of county travel.
-$1000 fine plus court costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-Blood Draw Fee - $42.50
-DL revocation - 30 months
-IID - 30 months
-AODA(FDL)
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

-Court orders the refusal 2016TR402 be reopened and dismissed.

-Court remands the defendant to the custody of the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

Court adjourned at 12:08 p.m.
Settlement Form (PTC)
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 27, 2016 at 11:30 am.

11:05 a.m.No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Michael Sias present.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Sias - met with the DA and an agreement has been reached.  Court sets for plea & sentencing on September 27, 2016 at 11:30 a.m.

Court adjourned at 11:06 a.m.
Status hearing on August 2, 2016 at 11:00 am.

10:12 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Michael Sias.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Sias - has received the Discovery but has not received an offer.  Court sets for Status Hearing on August 2, 2016 at 11:00 a.m. 

Court adjourned at 10:13 a.m.
State's
from Atty Michael Sias requesting the 07/19 Status Hearing be rescheduled due to a conflict.
Status hearing on July 19, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Demand for Jury Trial
Discovery Demand
By Atty Michael Sias
Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Status hearing on July 5, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

9:07 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs the defendant of his/her right to an attorney.  Defendant stands mute.  Court enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.  Court goes over right to counsel.  Defendant waives right to counsel.  Court accepts waiver.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond and conditions of:  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Court will set for Status Hearing on July 5, 2016 at 10:30 a.m.  Defendant to make appointment with the DA's office.

Court adjourned at 9:11 a.m.
**PROCESSING COMPLETE**
